eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils

Class TripleGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils.TripleGenerator

  • public class TripleGenerator
extends Object
    Generates a collection of RDF triples from the attributes of a given feature.
    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Kostas Patroumpas

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TripleGenerator(Configuration config)
      Constructs a TripleGenerator for transforming a feature (as a record of attributes) into RDF triples

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearTriples()
      Cleans up all triples resulted from conversion so far
      Map<String,Integer> getStatistics()
      Provides the statistics collected during transformation (i.e., count of transformed values per attribute)
      List<org.apache.jena.graph.Triple> getTriples()
      Provides a collection of triples resulting from conversion (usually from a single input feature)
      String transform(String uuid, Map<String,String> row, String wkt, int targetSRID, Classification classific)
      Converts the given feature (a tuple of thematic attributes and its geometry WKT) into RDF triples
      void transformCategory2RDF(String uuid, String name, String parent_uuid)
      Transforms a given category in a (possibly hierarchical) classification scheme into RDF triples FIXME: Current handling fits the classification scheme suggested by the SLIPO ontology for Points of Interest (POI)
      void transformCustomThematic2RDF(String uri, Map<String,String> attrValues, Classification classific)
      Transforms all thematic (i.e., non-spatial) attributes according to a custom ontology specified in a YML format
      void transformGeometry2RDF(String uri, String wkt, int srid)
      Converts representation of a geometry WKT into suitable RDF triple(s) depending on the specified spatial ontology
      void transformPlainThematic2RDF(String uri, Map<String,String> attrValues)
      Handles all thematic (i.e., non-spatial) attributes of a feature, by simply issuing a triple with the original attribute name as property

    • Constructor Detail

      • TripleGenerator

        public TripleGenerator(Configuration config)
        Constructs a TripleGenerator for transforming a feature (as a record of attributes) into RDF triples
        Parameters:
        config - User-specified configuration for the transformation process.

    • Method Detail

      • getTriples

        public List<org.apache.jena.graph.Triple> getTriples()
        Provides a collection of triples resulting from conversion (usually from a single input feature)
        Returns:
        A list of RDF triples

      • clearTriples

        public void clearTriples()
        Cleans up all triples resulted from conversion so far

      • getStatistics

        public Map<String,Integer> getStatistics()
        Provides the statistics collected during transformation (i.e., count of transformed values per attribute)
        Returns:
        A Map containing attribute names (keys) and their respective counts (values)

      • transform

        public String transform(String uuid,
                        Map<String,String> row,
                        String wkt,
                        int targetSRID,
                        Classification classific)
        Converts the given feature (a tuple of thematic attributes and its geometry WKT) into RDF triples
        Parameters:
        uuid - The UUID to be assigned to the URIs in the resulting triples
        row - Attribute values for each thematic (non-spatial) attribute
        wkt - Well-Known Text representation of the geometry
        targetSRID - The EPSG identifier of the Coordinate Reference System of the geometry
        classific - The classification scheme used in the category assigned to the feature
        Returns:
        The URI assigned to this feature and used in its resulting RDF triples

      • transformPlainThematic2RDF

        public void transformPlainThematic2RDF(String uri,
                                       Map<String,String> attrValues)
                                throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Handles all thematic (i.e., non-spatial) attributes of a feature, by simply issuing a triple with the original attribute name as property
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI assigned to this feature
        attrValues - Attribute values for each thematic (non-spatial) attribute of the feature
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException

      • transformGeometry2RDF

        public void transformGeometry2RDF(String uri,
                                  String wkt,
                                  int srid)
        Converts representation of a geometry WKT into suitable RDF triple(s) depending on the specified spatial ontology
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI assigned to this feature
        wkt - Well-Known Text representation of the geometry
        srid - The EPSG identifier of the Coordinate Reference System of the geometry

      • transformCustomThematic2RDF

        public void transformCustomThematic2RDF(String uri,
                                        Map<String,String> attrValues,
                                        Classification classific)
                                 throws UnsupportedEncodingException
        Transforms all thematic (i.e., non-spatial) attributes according to a custom ontology specified in a YML format
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI assigned to this feature
        attrValues - Attribute values for each thematic (non-spatial) attribute of the feature
        classific - The classification scheme used in the category assigned to the feature
        Throws:
        UnsupportedEncodingException

      • transformCategory2RDF

        public void transformCategory2RDF(String uuid,
                                  String name,
                                  String parent_uuid)
        Transforms a given category in a (possibly hierarchical) classification scheme into RDF triples FIXME: Current handling fits the classification scheme suggested by the SLIPO ontology for Points of Interest (POI)
        Parameters:
        uuid - A universally unique identifier (UUID) assigned to the category
        name - The name of this category according to the classification
        parent_uuid - The universally unique identifier (UUID) assigned to the parent of this category in the classification scheme
